32995817.review: В детстве у меня было четыре игры о рыбке Фредди из пяти, включая эту, и все их я обожала до того, что готова была проходить и перепроходить часами, благо рандомизация событий и загадок делала каждое прохождение отличным от предыдущего. Сейчас я убеждена, что до сих пор не появилось компании, которая бы делала детские игры лучше, чем Humongous Entertainment - эти ребята подходили к своему делу с душой и фантазией, и в результате игры получались очень яркими, смешными и (что немаловажно) довольно умными. Разработчикам - огромное спасибо за счастливые воспоминания, ну а игру я чрезвычайно рекомендую детям всех возрастов, а также взрослым, которым захотелось ненадолго отвлечься от своих взрослых проблем :)

24715234.review:
Did you know that when I first attempted to play this game as a child, I was too scared to play it because of the ghost character?

I bet you didn't, you smug sons of b****es.

Freddi Fish 2 is the continuation of the rich world of the titular character and his psychologically complex detective fish friend, Luther. While they are attending school one day, a mob from the Squidfather hits up the school, stealing supplies from it and frightening childrend, while disguised as a ghost. So Freddi and Luther must follow a trail deep into the bowels of Hell itself in order to uncover the dastardly truth of this sinister plot.

I might be making fun of the game, but to be completely fair, I did enjoy it far more than the original Freddi Fish.

The game centers around you catching the alleged ghost haunting the school by getting supplies for a trap. It seems a little a**-backwards, since Freddi and Luther have no literal idea when the ghost might come back, even if it does. I think their efforts would have been better spent actually tracking down the ghost. Hell, I even tried to at first but the b****** just up and disappeared after I chased him for a bit.

While you hunt down these various items, you get to explore are far more enjoyable and colorful world, and while the characters don't exactly fit in it like the last installment, it still looks more friendly than the ominous backgrounds of Missing Kelp Seeds. I was actually surprised with how much there is to do in the world this time around as well. Many characters will break into song (most of them not that great), there's a Space Invaders minigame (which is watered down, but still fun... no pun intended), and even movies you can watch (all of which center on dumb puns, not unlike my last pun).

While I can say that just throwing more sh** into a game doesn't make it better (A lesson that could be sorely learned by the Call of Duty franchise), it'll give the little snots a little something extra if they ever play this game. Which I assumed they won't. The only people that do these days are greasy f***s that are far too old to be playing a kids game.

Like... me...

A final point that I'd like to make, is that for this being a "Case of a Haunted Schoolhouse", there isn't a lot of mystery to it. All you're doing is collecting items for the trap. I mean, it is obvious to anyone who's older than 5 to tell that the ghost is f***ing fake, but the game goes out of its way to explain who the ghost really is before you even get a chance to start suspecting the various characters in the game world. And it's the same two damn punks from Missing Kelp Seeds and that cliche pun on The Godfather. When I saw those two tumors appear on screen again, I just sighed and rested my hand on my forehead, and promised myself it'll all be over soon.

Luckily enough, it was. This game, while larger than Freddi Fish Uno, is still pretty easy on the run-time, but also low on the relpy value. It definitely fits into most of the Humongous game tropes, with gathering items, talking to zany characters, and playing minigames along the way... but it all feels disconnected in the large world. It doesn't feel as creative as Humongous' later efforts to make fun kids games like Pajama Sam or Spy Fox 3. But it's still and improvement from the first game, and that's definitely a plus in my book. For all that, I'm giving Freddi Fish 2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse a 5/10.

23303274.review:
Freddi Fish 2 is one of the very first PC games I ever played. I played it off a CD I got in a cereal box on my dad's ancient Windows 95 computer, which I had for about 10 years. 

This is a game I have this strange nostalgic fondness for despite fundamentally being a simple kids game. The plot centers on the two characters, Freddi and Luther, who have to discover the identity of a mysterious ghost who steals the toys of all of the other children. And they have to gather various objects inorder to build a trap to capture the ghost. Like I said it is fundamentally a children's game so the humor is a bit predictable, the puzzles are very simple and you're frequently told what to do and what to get. (IE: Freddi says you need scissors to cut some kelp, you need a wrench to remove a wheel, you need to ask a character for a combination to a lock. Etc.) 

Something the game does have much like other Humungous games is random elements. When you start the game up, certain elements are removed wheras others appear. For instance, all of the trap items you need to locate are randomized during every playthrough. While this isn't that big of a difference it does make the second or third playthrough feel different. When I was a kid this blew me away at the time but nowadays it just feels like a way to pad out the game time. Since it is a very short game.

Going through it on the first try you can beat the game in maybe 30 minutes. This is a common aspect of Humungous games compared to other SCUMM games like the ones by Lucasarts. So it might not hold your attention as an adult, but it will return you back to a day when you were a kid, and every game was a treasure to behold.

19955143.review:
To begin the review, I would like to give initial thoughts. Starting the game I could already tell this was a master piece. The stunning visuals and superb sound quality left me absolutely awestruck. The downside to the unbelievable graphics is that I could only run this game at about 98-100fps on mega ultra settings.

 The story is quite linear with several sidequests that interweave with the main storyline, similar to The Witcher 3: Wildhunt, but was executed far better in my opinion. The characters, unlike in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt are not 1 dimensional and have interesting personalities and backstories. For me, the most memorable quest was finding the glasses in the hole, I can vividly remember recieving my first weapon as a reward: A scoped slingshot. It was easily the best weapon in the game, but since I had specced into intelligence it was practically useless. This makes the combat far harder, I remember the final battle against the ghost took me several tries to beat. This is not helped by the unweildy combat system that utilises QTES(Quick Time Events) which seem very out of place, considering this is kids game. In several areas of the huge open world map, there are big scary male fish that try to oppress you with musical instruments. You have the option to initiate combat with them, but it takes a lot of grinding in order to get to their level.

 There is a high level of interaction within the environment, my favourite place is the movie theatre, with the right button combination you are able to play reruns of the hit tv show, The Fresh Prince of Belair. Other than the horrible combat system, another gripe i have this game is the economy, it is very clear that the octopus has a monopoly over the entire pulley market, as one pulley will often run you 5 sea urchins, which can be very difficult to come across, while exploring the gigantic open world. My last gripe is this game, is more of a personal one, after playing for a while I literally developed cancer, this game cost me so much money, that i was unabable to pay for my hospital bills. Since this is the only game I own I am just sitting in the hospital playing this game, waiting for the sweet, sweet release of death.

Best game ever 10/10

This game sucks fish sticks

19412936.review: A story that begins as a basic search for your criminal ghost evolves into something much more complex and morally nuanced. Like in Freddi Fish 1; we’re drawn into a struggle between several groups competing to solve the mystery, and deciding which of their imperfect post-spook philosophies to align with made me pause to consider how I wanted events to play out. Even the highly questionable Institute has a tempting reason to side with them, and turning away from them in my playthrough wasn’t as clear-cut a choice as I’d expected. I was impressed by the sympathy shown toward the schoolmates, too - even the most irredeemable murderer is explored and given a trace of humanity.

18752465.review:
Before I get too in depth in this full on review let me start by saying this. Freddi Fish 2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse is by far one of the best gaming experiences of our generation. The challenging mental puzzles will leave you breathless as you try comprehend their hidden meanings. The answers are always as they seem, though an experienced veteran of the cloak and dagger genre will find a way to prolong to mystery. I cannot state enough how impactful this game is to the gaming communtiy and I feel it is my oblogation to convey this simple message. Freddi Fish 2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse is a refreshing take on the childrens click entertainment platformer series. It's endless innovations are awe inspiring. However, some users may find the graphics somewhat lackluster compaired to franchises such as Far Cry or the Elder Scrolls series. Let me make this abundantly clear... You wasting precious moments of your temporary existence by passing this game off as childs play. Freddi Fish2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse will enchant your senses with its gripping story telling and rich user interaction. I beg you buy this game, not just for me but treat yourself to something miraculous. Games like Freddi Fish2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse come around once, maybe twice in a decade. Don't become one of the mindless drones that drudges through the capitalist lifestyle. Submitting to a slave wage grind of an unfufilled life without living. Freddi Fish2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse is the booming echo of revitalizing humanitarinisum.

-Buy the game and change your life, before you have lost the will to live.

16555683.review:
tl;dr: If ya played it as a kid or are getting it for kids, buy it. If you're an adult and have never played this game, it's almost certainly not going to do anything for ya, and ya should probably pass on it.


This game and any other Humongous Entertainment game should only be bought for one of two reasons:

1) You're getting it as a game for your young kids. That's how I was introduced to this game and it's stuck with me ever since. Freddi Fish, Pajama Sam, Spy Fox, Putt-Putt, they're all nostalgia mascots for my childhood and even playing this game now I still love these characters; as cheesy as they all may be now.

2) You're like me and are reliving your childhood games. Trust me, even though this game is easy as hell and you can blast through it in under an hour, it's still fun to relive a game that you enjoyed as a kid.

I spent a ton of the time I was on this game just screwin' around with the environmental stuff, which is half the fun of these old HE games. The story's stupid and would make Scooby Doo hang his head in shame of how laughable this "mystery" is, but it's still entertaining as hell to play through just so you can swim around the ocean, meet all of the Freddis' pals, and just see what you can do.

16504409.review: A brilliant game for kids, levels are more interactive than most modern games. Luther has sick jokes.

16290002.review:
Laatst verscheen de eerste trailer van [i]Fallout 4[/i], een game die belooft 'de grootste game allertijden' te worden. Daarnaast verscheen dit jaar ook [i]Grand Theft Auto V[/i] voor de PC, met een immens grote wereldkaart en met zoveel realisme dat mijn tere kinderzieltje het haast niet aankon. Ook deze game claimde 'de grootste' te zijn. Weet je wat ik daar van vind?

[b]Onzin[/b].

Je leest het goed: pure onzin. De droeftoeters die bovenstaande daadwerkelijk beweren, zijn net zo naïef als Bassie de clown. Nee, beste mensen, hoor mij aan: [i]Freddi Fish 2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse[/i], van [i]Humongous Entertainment[/i], is de daadwerkelijke Shawshank Redemption onder de video games. Dit meesterwerk was ruim zijn tijd vooruit en zelfs tot de dag van vandaag kan dit stukje perfectie menig volk en bourgeoisie verbazen. Plebs spelen GTA, patriciërs spelen Freddi Fish.

Protagonist in dit meesterwerk is Freddi de vis, die samen met haar vriend* Loebas de zaak van de bespookte school moeten oplossen. Hier begint het al; het plot is simpelweg fantastisch. Het tikt niet aan Pulp Fiction of Forrest Gump, nee - het overstijgt het, met [b]gemak[/b]. De combinatie van een femine bolleboos en een naïve Vlaming, [b]in visvorm[/b], is als [i]Elvis[/i] en [i]The Beatles[/i] bij elkaar. Stoort het feit dat het beoogde publiek kinderen was tijdens het maken van de game? Welnee, [i]The Lion King[/i] was toch ook voor kinderen bedoeld? Nou kun je die twee niet echt vergelijken natuurlijk, één is duidelijk beter dan de ander. 

Hoe zit het dan met de game zelf? Welke gangs zijn er uit te moorden, welke steden worden herbouwd na een nucleare ramp, welke tijdlijn van de alternatieve geschiedenis volgt dit epos daadwerkelijk? De gameplay valt te omschrijven met de volgende woorden: het spelen van de game is als het leegdrinken van een fles Fanta (de Zuid-Europese versie, die extra oranje versie) na tien kilometer hardlopen met een zon die bloedverziekstralend heet is. Ken je dat gevoel? Dan ken je het gevoel van Freddi Fish 2. 

Muziek en presentatie zijn 'state of the art'. Een subtiele mix van Rembrandt van Rijn, Andy Warhole en [i]Ducktales[/i] zorgt voor een onvergetelijke ervaring, die zich al vanaf de eerste seconde permanent in je brein nestelt. De zoete klanken doen denken aan grote namen als [i]Coldplay[/i], [i]Avicii[/i] en hier en daar zelfs [i]Corry en de Rekels[/i]. Je hoornvlies zal een massage krijgen, wellicht is er zelfs sprake van een oor-gasme. Snap je?!

Er zitten hier en daar nog leuke verwijzingen in naar andere personages van Humongous Entertainment, zoals de infantiele [i]Pyjama  Sam[/i] en de olijke auto [i]Putt-Putt[/i], die later [i]Pixar[/i] geïnspireerd heeft om de kaskraker [i]Cars[/i] te produceren. Ja, jongens, dit is een waar godsgeschenk die de engelen vanuit alle zeven hemelen hebben moeten maken - een simpele sterveling zou nooit tot zo'n magnefique creatie zijn gekomen, zelfs een groep van twaalf of meer mensen zou moeite hebben de ontwikkeling van  een game als deze te bewerkstelligen. 

Kortom, mocht je net weer geld hebben gekregen (verjaardag, vakantiegeld, wat kan mij het schelen), schroom dan niet en doe jezelf een plezier door dit genot aan te schaffen. Het is wetenschappelijk bewezen* dat het spelen van Freddi Fish 2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse bijdraagt aan een betere gezondheid en levensstijl. Er zijn gevallen bekend van personen die zijn gestopt met roken of het gebruik van verdovende middelen door slechts het horen van de naam van de game. Dat is hoe goed deze game is. 

[quote]Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever. - Mahatma Gandhi.[/quote]

Dus kopen nu, ouwe snoepert.

*: Loebas en Freddi hebben geen (semi-)amoreuze relatie en dat probeer ik ook zeker niet te impliceren.
**: Onderzoeksresultaten gebasseerd op de Margriet uit Oktober 2006.

13199640.review:
During the late 90’s/early 2000’s Humongous Entertainment released an absolutely fantastic stream of “edutainment” point and click adventures for children. These titles focus on a range of light academics including basic geography, basic to upper elementary level mathematics, logical thinking, critical thinking and puzzle solving, topped off with reinforcement of good manners and polite social etiquette. At the lower end of the age spectrum, they may require some adult supervision and supportive guidance, but there is no better series of games for a child’s first venture into PC gaming.

I played the Haunted Schoolhouse right after finishing the Kelp Seed adventure and I remember not being okay with the whole “Haunted” part. Between the already scary sharks, and then some sort of paranormal activity in an elementary school, I remember that this game really frightened me at first. I think it was almost a year before I went back and actually really enjoyed it. It is by no means inappropriate, but I would recommend some supervision at first until you see how your child reacts to some of the opening scenes and concepts.

A game about making a rube goldberg-esque machine, what more could you ever want?
Well, yeah, okay.
Art style in this one looks a lot better for starters. The fetch quests build up to something and the puzzles are a bit trickier, or at least there's not as much handholding, though it's still pretty simple. Other than that, not much else to say except good nostalgia fuel here :V

10154364.review: Arguably the definitive game of a generation, it blends post-modern philosophical themes with beautiful storytelling to create a game that will be revered for decades to come. Few games have dared to stray into the territory that Freddi Fish 2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse does. It was revolutionary in its time for its allegory of the Book of Job from the Bible. Along with Put-Put, Freddi Fish will always have a prominent place in the halls of American literature.

10140695.review: Pretty short game i used to spend countless hours playing freddi fish when i was a youngster should my little sister it and she beat it withen an hour or so now she wants to get another one to play i would also recommend pjama sam

10044893.review:
BOO!

On a serious note though... I played this when I was of age, and really enjoyed it more than the first one; still enjoy playing it for whenever I want to have some nostalgia.

Another point and click cult classic. This game is more intended for children, as the game is very short, depending what you need to do and where to go.

This time you take a visit to Freddi and Luther's school house. A ghost is haunting the school and stealing kids toys in the process. Who is the ghost and will our fish heroine and silly sidesick capture it?

Just like The Case of the Missing Kelp Seeds, where you need to go and what you need to get is randomized at the start of the game. Need either a life preserver, rope, helmet, cork, a-very-wordy-device, trident, and/or a [strike]pullet[/strike] pulley.

New characters to meet, with a reoccuring character, Ray the Stingray. Draw something on the school chalkboard, watch silly short clips in the theater, and keep Luther from that fishing hook! Stop and play a mini game of spitting at crabs on a walk wall and watch them fall on Lurther! Watch out for the coconut crab though, he'll bonk you.

You may face some backtracking, but it's possible to minimize it once you know what to do after a few playthroughs. Some of the soundtrack is rather catchy, like the save/load theme and a few track loops in the school.

Just like any H.E. game, there's sillyness to click on in each background scene that kids may find amusing.

Feel free to get the Freddi Fish (or H.E. complete) bundle if you enjoyed these games as a kid, or if your child liked one of these games.

Join and/or follow if you wish.

10039285.review: A modern classic, Freddi Fish 2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse is a clever (albeit blatant) satire on the McCarthyism era in United States history. Although I found it to be quite monotonous in storytelling, the character development and dialogue was some of the best we've seen this decade. If you're looking for a real work of art, Freddi Fish 2: The Case of the Haunted Schoolhouse is for you.

9994596.review:
10/10

My inner child is frightened at the ghost, and so is the adult me

9992442.review:
Freddy Fisch (bzw im deutschen bei den ersten beiden (oder vllt 3) titeln "Fritzi Fisch") hat seinen platz auf Steam gefunden!

Die Spielreihe ist eine der besten Spiele für Kinder und macht mir aufgrund der nostalgie von früher immernoch spaß! : )

Momentan gibt es das Spiel leider nur auf Englisch, dies liegt wohl an den Lizenzen die überall versträut sind, die Macher sammeln die Erlaubnisse ein und werden gegebenenfalls auch die andern Sprachen und damit sicherlich auch die Deutsche ausgabe noch nachreichen.

Freddi und ihr kleiner grüner Freund sind sowas ähnliches wie Spongebob und Patrick bevor es Spongebob überhaupt gab nur etwas weniger "geisteskrank" und bringen immer wieder mal kleine wortwitze und überflüssige kommentare mit ins Spiel rein.

In der Welt gibt es viel zu entdecken, wie bei den meisten point n click adventures gibt es viele gegenstände mit dennen man interagieren kann die eine kleine Animation, Lieder, Matheübungen oder sonstiges von sich geben auch wenn sie für das Spiel selbst nicht wichtig sind, was das Spiel lebendiger und freudiger für Kinder gestaltet.

Ein erwachsener kann das Spiel in etwa 30 minuten durchspielen wenn er sich noch mit anderen nebensachen leicht beschäftigt, ein Kind wird dabei etwas mehr Zeit in anspruch nehmen und viel Freude am Spiel haben.


Ich bin sehr froh das Freddy Fish seinen Platz in Steam gefunden hat und es soweit verbessert wurde das es auch auf Windows 7 und 8 funktioniert (falls das original welches ich nicht mehr besitze das nicht getan hat) und hoffe auf ein Nachreichen der deutschen Version.


Zu Teil 2: 
Der Zweite Teil ist meiner Meinung nach der schwächste der 5 Teile, jedoch wird jedes kleine Kind dieses Spiel dennoch lieben da es einfach genial ist : )

39326707.review:
This game just has a certain charm that the other Freddi Fish games can't quite capture.

The visuals are awesome, there are a bunch of memorable characters and songs to go along with them, the music just sounds amazing. 

And this game has a ton of replay value, with different things happening each time you play. There's also a bunch of neat stuff hidden that you can find if you look hard enough, and even I'm finding out about new things each time I play.
